description: The process by which bread dough expands due to the production of carbon dioxide gas from yeast. name: Humidity
type: Environmental Factor
description: Humidity refers to the amount of water vapor present in the air. In baking, it plays a crucial role in creating the desired texture and appearance of bread. name: Complex Flavors
type: Taste Attribute
description: Complex flavors are a combination of various taste sensations that enhance the overall flavor profile of bread. name: Golden-Brown Color
type: Visual Attribute
description: The golden-brown color is a characteristic visual attribute of baked bread, indicating that it has been properly cooked. name: Maillard Reaction
type: Chemical Process
description: The Maillard reaction is a chemical reaction between amino acids and reducing sugars that occurs during baking, contributing to the bread"s flavor and color. name: Dough Texture
type: Bread Component
description: The dough is a mixture of flour, water, and other ingredients that forms the base of bread. name: Complex flavors
type: Flavor Development
description: Complex flavors are a combination of various taste sensations that enhance the overall flavor profile of baked goods. name: Maillard reaction
type: Chemical Reaction
description: The Maillard reaction is a chemical process that occurs during baking, responsible for the browning of the crust and the development of complex flavors in bread. It involves the reaction between proteins and sugars at high temperatures. name: Interior Texture
type: Bread Component
description: The interior of the bread is the part inside the crust, which should be moist and airy. name: Bread Crust
type: Attribute
description: The outer layer of baked bread. name: Baking
type: Process Step
description: Baking is the final step where the dough is cooked in an oven, resulting in a baked bread product. name: browning of the crust
type: Baking Phenomenon
description: The browning of the crust is a chemical reaction that occurs during baking, responsible for the development of complex flavors and the characteristic golden-brown color of bread. name: Baking Process
type: Process
description: The baking process involves the transformation of raw dough into a baked product, such as bread. name: Browning of the crust
type: Physical Change
description: The browning of the crust is a visible change that occurs during baking, contributing to the aesthetic appeal and flavor development of bread. name: Crust Formation
type: Physical Transformation
description: The process by which the outer layer of bread becomes crisp.
